intro: Eriospermum dissitiflorum, commonly known as the clustered eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Eriospermum dissitiflorum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
